definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)

pinyin: Ye1 he2 hua2 Jian4 zheng4 ren2

sentences.english: Want to be an assistant judge or notary.
sentences.chinese: 想成为一名助理法官或公证人。

sentences.english: At the trial, all witnesses are required to attend the court.
sentences.chinese: 在审理过程中，所有证人都应到庭。

sentences.english: The hands of the witnesses must be the first in putting him to death, and then the hands of all the people.
sentences.chinese: 见证人要先下手，然后众民也下手将他治死。

sentences.english: The priest in the Fermanagh will case in the witness box .
sentences.chinese: 弗马纳的神父站在证人席上陈述。

sentences.english: The witnesses were subpoenaed to attend the trial.
sentences.chinese: 用传票传唤证人参加审判。

sentences.english: Do you want me to be here when you hand him the money as a witness?
sentences.chinese: 你交钱的时候，要不要我在旁边当个证人？

sentences.english: But he is wary of filming witnesses, and draws the line at juries.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他很担心证人入镜，也不允许陪审团被拍摄。

sentences.english: The witness was cross-examined by the defending counsel.
sentences.chinese: 证人受到辩护律师的诘问。

sentences.english: Practice repeatedly proves that history is the most telling witness.
sentences.chinese: 实践反复证明历史是最有力的见证人。

sentences.english: I was called to the witness box.
The chief method is to take depositions of parties and witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 主要的方法是录取当事人和证人的宣誓证言。

sentences.english: The lawyer confuted the testimony of the witness by showing actual photographs of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 律师出示那次事故的真实照片，驳倒了证人的证言。

sentences.english: Do you believe the witness's statement?
This certificate shows the holder is a qualified Power Industry translator.
sentences.chinese: 本证书为持证人从事电力行业翻译事务的资格证明。

sentences.english: Morris Chang is living proof of Taiwan's ability to transform its economy.
sentences.chinese: 张忠谋是台湾经济转型能力的见证人之一。

sentences.english: Other evidence that the witness provided was fabricated.
sentences.chinese: 证人提供的另一证据也是伪造的。

definition: oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)
to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
